gurmukhi: ਬਰਖਾ ਚਤੁਰਮਾਸ ਭਿਦੋ ਨ ਪਖਾਨ ਸਿਲਾ ਨਿਪਜੈ ਨ ਧਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਅਨਿਕ ੳੁਪਾਵ ਕੈ
transliteration: Barakhaa Chaturamaas Bhido N Pakhaan Silaa , Nipajai N Dhaan Paan Anik Oupaav Kai ?
translation: Just as a stone accumulates no water even during monsoon rains and does not become soft, it can yield no crop despite diligent efforts,

gurmukhi: ੳੁਦਿਤ ਬਸੰਤ ਪਰਫੁਲਿਤ ਬਨਾਸਪਤੀ ਮੳੁਲੈ ਨ ਕਰੀਰੁ ਅਾਦਿ ਬੰਸ ਕੇ ਸੁਭਾਵ ਕੈ
transliteration: Udit Basant Paradhulit Banaasapatee , Maulai N Kareeru Aadi Bans Kay Soubhaav Kai ?
translation: Just as all the trees and bushes blossom in the spring season, but due to peculiarity of the species, (Acacia arabica) Keekar trees do not flower,

gurmukhi: ਸਿਹਜਾ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਨਿਹਫਲ ਬਾਝ ਬਧੂ ਹੁੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਧਾਨ ਦੁਖੋ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਦੁਰਾਵ ਕੈ
transliteration: Sihajaa Sanjog Bhog Nihadhal Baajh Badhoo , Hui N Aadhaan Doukho Doubidhaa Duraav Kai ?
translation: Just as an infertile woman remains bereft of pregnancy despite enjoying nuptial bed with her husband, and she keeps hiding her distress.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਮਮ ਕਾਗ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਰਾਲ ਸਭਾ ਰਹਿਓ ਨਿਰਾਹਾਰ ਮੁਕਤਾਹਲ ਅਪਿਅਾਵ ਕੈ ॥੨੩੭॥
transliteration: Taisay Mam Kaag Saadhasangati Maraal Sabhaa , Rahiao Niraahaar Moukataahal Apiaav Kai ?237?
translation: Similarly I, a crow (used to eating filth) remained bereft of pearl-like food of Naam Simran even in the company of swans. (237)
